content: There was somebody that wrote a short piece on these threads last year right, after the election, when it was clear how much we had lost....remember?? In that piece he wrote about how, with both houses of congress, the White House and soon the Supreme Court we would be in a world of s***!! That poor guy got his guts handed to him, he was some kind of scare monger. Some kind of anti Obama freak!! Some kind of alarmist who just could not accept change! He won't change the Supreme Court!! Jeeesh get over your self was the mildest of it, if I recall....do you?? Well let's see, we have Ruth Bader Ginsberg who's damned near dead, and justice Kennedy who makes Souter look like a raging conservative and then what, oh yeah that's right a "balanced court"...hmmm....Oh really?? Who the heck was that guy!!??!! Just a minute let me think............oh yeah....it was me, I remember now...... So, we have running the country now...... Rahm Emmanuel, Ruth Bader Gibsberg, Kennedy, all of them, 60 dems in the senate and who knows how many in the congress....OH!! I almost forgot Obama....... Yep, welcome to Obie's world....it's gonna be great!!! Got guns?? give 'em up!! Got rights?? Give 'em up!! Got objections?? Better keep them to your self, if you know what's good for ya pal!! It's a brave new world out there!!!

It's a brave new world out there!!!

content: And as a person in the middle ,neither liberal or conservative I am glad a liberal leaning judge is being replaced with some one that might be the same. A court that is stacked to much to either side is what would truly hurt this country. Personally I hope a conservative judge retires and gets replace with one like Sandra Day O'Connor who you never knew which way she would lean. That would balance the court back out again to the pre bush years. --Savage

content: Obama tried to get other countries like France, Italy, Germany etc to spend like we did to get the economy running again. They said "No Thank You". Obama tried to get other countries to put more troops in Afghanistan. Again No Thank You. G-20 said "No Thank You" to him. [but he gave Hugo a thumbs up) Now he has a Yes Ma'am on the Super Court. Can Barry do anything right? Or how do you like the Change now?

content: quote: Originally posted by tawodi: There was somebody that wrote a short piece on these threads last year right, after the election, when it was clear how much we had lost....remember?? In that piece he wrote about how, with both houses of congress, the White House and soon the Supreme Court we would be in a world of s***!! That poor guy got his guts handed to him, he was some kind of scare monger. Some kind of anti Obama freak!! Some kind of alarmist who just could not accept change! He won't change the Supreme Court!! Jeeesh get over your self was the mildest of it, if I recall....do you?? Well let's see, we have Ruth Bader Ginsberg who's damned near dead, and justice Kennedy who makes Souter look like a raging conservative and then what, oh yeah that's right a "balanced court"...hmmm....Oh really?? Who the heck was that guy!!??!! Just a minute let me think............oh yeah....it was me, I remember now...... So, we have running the country now...... Rahm Emmanuel, Ruth Bader Gibsberg, Kennedy, all of them, 60 dems in the senate and who knows how many in the congress....OH!! I almost forgot Obama....... Yep, welcome to Obie's world....it's gonna be great!!! Got guns?? give 'em up!! Got rights?? Give 'em up!! Got objections?? Better keep them to your self, if you know what's good for ya pal!! It's a brave new world out there!!! Well I do remember writing a piece about Government being a Diamond, not a Rectangle, with Congress at the top, the Presidency and the Supreme Court on the two sides and the People, with their Vote and 2nd Amendment Rights at the bottom. Each of these was supposed to be a "Check and Balance" system of Powers and Authorities to keep the other from becoming a Tyranny... CONGRESS passes laws, amends the Constitution, declares War, and has Control over the Money (Taxes) to create and pay for Military, etc etc - - That is a lot of POWER!! The PRESIDENCY can Set Foreign Policy, Wage War with Control of the Military, and Veto Congress - That is a lot of POWER!! The SUPREME COURT can Veto both the President and Congress by declaring actions and laws UNCONSTITUTIONAL, but such a declaration in meaningless unless backed by Congress's cooperation of laws and money, or the President's ability to apply military and legal FORCE - Still, that is a lot of POWER!! The PEOPLE can vote in good people who will not misuse the above POWERS, but if Tyranny still results, an ARMED POPULATION (2nd Amendment) can rise up and put down the Tyranny by Force, Invoking the Introductory Paragraphs of the DECLARATION of INDEPENDENCE!! - That is a lot of POWER!! The worst danger comes from the possibility that the top three parts of the Diamond become so closely nit in one political agenda that they no longer "Check and Balance" each other... In other words, the gravest danger to this Country is that the White House, The Senate, The House of Representatives, and the Supreme Court become so aligned with the AGENDA of one Political Party that they virtually become a "rubber stamp" for each other. At that point, they would become a Tyrannical Oligarchy, or even a Dictatorship, if all the ideas come from the White House, and everyone else simply sustain those ideas - - I said we were fast approaching that, as the Senate moved closer to a "non-filibuster" condition as "turn-coat" Arlen Specter switched sides. Now, with the liberal selection of Sotomayor, someone who said before a camera the Federal Appeals Courts "Make policy", for Supreme Court - we could be rapidly approaching the Oligarchy... By the way Courts are NEVER to make policy!! They are to judge what is lawful and not lawful... Policy is to be put forward by the President, and established one way or another by debate and passage as law in Congress!! NO ONE can debate any Court action. No ONE can vote for, or vote OUT Federal Judges once they are in place - for LIFE!! The Supreme Court itself has become an unchallengeable Oligarchy as it is, and has moved ITSELF to the top of the diamond of power... And is shoving all else inevitable to the bottom! In the near future, it may needs be that the PEOPLE at least threaten to use their POWER of VETO against all three, before the Constitution is relegated to a mere scrape of interesting foolishness from times long past and in need of forgetting - - Wandering and Wondering

content: I don't have any problem with it, but has anybody noticed how some attack me rather than refute the position? Now as to rights The 1968 gun control act. The ongoing battle with the Dizzy City council defying the supreme court ruling to the point where the congress has rescinded the right to vote for their representative in congress that they were going to grant. The ability to travel without restriction anywhere in this country. The ability to vote by the populace and have it respected rather then overturned by the whim of a court ANY court as long as it is called supreme in what ever state. The ninth circus court continually legislating from the bench to the point that it a laughing stock even to the other appelate courts. To chose the car you want to drive with out penalty. the house you want to own, the way it is powered, what underarm deodorant you use. Being marginalised, demonised then taxed in a penurious way, once the general public is convinced that they can steal from you, because Clinton, or somebody else, told them it is alright to do that? And Hilary's brothers law firm, makes two billion plus dollars for the tobacco settlement. Our schools are turning out students that are rated fourteenth in the world and we pay an average of three times the amount to educate them that other countries do? I can keep going if you want and if you don't think these are rights, remember you are PAYING for all this crap to be done to YOU!!! A self inflicted size fourteen anal aperture at your own expense!! I don't think this was the founding fathers original intent.....do you??

Our schools are turning out students that are rated fourteenth in the world and we pay an average of three times the amount to educate them that other countries do? I can keep going if you want and if you don't think these are rights, remember you are PAYING for all this crap to be done to YOU!!! A self inflicted size fourteen anal aperture at your own expense!! content: quote: Originally posted by Yooper_tj: So tawodi's sure that Judge Sotomayor is going to take away his guns and his rights... Gunny's concerned that she's Puerto Rican and Diabetic(?)... Really, I wouldnt have known or cared but that was mentioned by all dems and Obama seems y'all are more concerned about that as a qualifier moreso than her 60-80% failure rate and dont let reading comprehension kick you in the azz PsychoABN fears a smoker... Duster sees a Yes Ma'am...Al Bundy, anyone? ...and I'm not touching this one: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost:The PEOPLE can vote in good people who will not misuse the above POWERS, but if Tyranny still results, an ARMED POPULATION (2nd Amendment) can rise up and put down the Tyranny by Force, Invoking the Introductory Paragraphs of the DECLARATION of INDEPENDENCE!! Fear not, fellas. The four horsemen of the apocalypse are all young and in pretty good health. The Kennedy court won't change enough to recognize in a Souter for Sotomayor deal...unless the New Judge S holds more sway with pr1cks like Scalia than Souter did... Jeebus. What was I thinking. You couldn't move Scalia off his self-righteous holier-than-thou square with a freekin D-9. It's hard to believe he's gotten so far from the expressed intent of the framers that we still allow blacks and women to vote, nevermind run for president or sit on the federal bench. Next thing you know, Vermont will want to become the 14th state.

title: Who wrote that last year???????

content: Sums it up The Supreme Court high hurdles contest By Michelle Malkin • May 27, 2009 09:33 AM Able to leap tall life obstacles in a single bound! Not all “compelling personal stories” are equal by Michelle Malkin <edit> Since when did securing a Supreme Court seat become a high hurdles contest? The White House and Democrats have turned Second Circuit judge Sonia Sotomayor’s nomination into a personal Olympics event. Pay no attention to her jurisprudence. She grew up in a Bronx public housing project. She was diagnosed with childhood diabetes at 8. Her father died a year later. And oh, by the way, did you hear that she was poor? It’s a “compelling personal story,” as we heard 20,956 times on Tuesday. Sotomayor’s a “real” person. Why, she even read Nancy Drew as a young girl, President Obama told us. She’s “faced down barriers, overcome the odds and lived out the American dream that brought her parents here so long ago,” Obama said. If Sotomayor were auditioning to be Oprah Winfrey’s fill-in host, I’d understand the over-the-top hyping of her life narrative. But isn’t anybody on Sotomayor’s side the least bit embarrassed by all this liberal condescension? Republicans are not allowed to mention Sotomayor’s ethnicity lest they be branded bigots, but every Democrat on cable television harped on her multicultural “diversity” and “obstacle”-climbing. President Obama made sure to roll his r’s when noting that her parents came from Puerrrrto Rrrrico. New York Sen. Schumer stated outright: “It’s long overdue that a Latino sit on the United States Supreme Court.” Color-coded tokenism dominated the headlines, with blaring references to Sotomayor as the high court’s potential “first Hispanic.” (Not true.) Missouri Sen. Claire McCaskill – one of the leading Democrats tasked with guiding Sotomayor through the nomination process — carried the “compelling personal story” talking points to the tokenist extreme in an interview on Fox News: “If you look at what this woman has been through, and the obstacles that she has had to overcome, I think she does have a richly, uniquely American experience that makes her incredibly qualified to pass judgment on some of the most important cases in our country,” McCaskill asserted. “Overcoming incredible odds and I think that is new to the courts. There have been a lot of privileged people that have landed on the Supreme Court. The fact that she has lived the life of the common American, trying to grow up in public housing, reaching for scholarships, reaching for the courtroom as a courtroom prosecutor, all of those things will make her a better and wiser judge. And I don’t think that is identity politics. I think that is the American experience.” Clever. Challenging Sotomayor’s credentials and extreme views on race and the law is not merely anti-Hispanic. It’s anti-American! More significantly, Sen. McCaskill waved the high-hurdle card after being asked to defend Sotomayor’s infamous statement at a 2001 University of California at Berkeley speech asserting brown-skin moral authority: “I would hope that a wise Latina woman with the richness of her experiences would more often than not reach a better conclusion than a white male who hasn’t lived that life.” McCaskill actually denied that Sotomayor had make the remarks, then argued the words were taken out of context. You want context? It’s even worse than that soundbite. As National Journal legal analyst Stuart Taylor reported, “Sotomayor also referred to the cardinal duty of judges to be impartial as a mere ‘aspiration because it denies the fact that we are by our experiences making different choices than others.’ And she suggested that ‘inherent physiological or cultural differences’ may help explain why ‘our gender and national origins may and will make a difference in our judging.’” The full speech was reprinted in something called the Berkeley La Raza Law Journal. “La Raza” is Spanish for “The Race.” Imagine if a white male Republican court nominee had published in a law review called “The Race.” The selective elevation of hardship-as-primary qualification demeans the entire judiciary. If personal turmoil makes one “incredibly qualified to pass judgment on some of the most important cases in our country,” let’s put reality-show couple Jon and Kate Gosselin on the bench. Millions of viewers tune in to watch their “compelling personal story” of life with eight children on television. It’s a “richly, uniquely American experience” of facing obstacles and overcoming the odds. Get them robes and gavels, stat. McCaskill’s assertion that “overcoming incredible odds” is “new to the courts” is ridiculous. Is she arguing that Thurgood Marshall, Felix Frankfurter, and Sandra Day O’Connor faced lower hurdles than Sotomayor? And how about Clarence Thomas, a descendant of slaves, grew up in abject poverty in the South without a father. The object lesson, of course, is that not all compelling personal stories are equal. Thomas’s crime, of course, was embracing the wrong ideology. So his incredible set of odds and obstacles don’t count in left-wing eyes. Democrats are eager to celebrate diversity, you see, as long as the diversely-pigmented pledge allegiance to the Left for life. 'http://michellemalkin.com/2009/05/27/the-supreme-court-high-hurdles-contest/'

And I don’t think that is identity politics. I think that is the American experience.” Clever. Challenging Sotomayor’s credentials and extreme views on race and the law is not merely anti-Hispanic. It’s anti-American! More significantly, Sen. McCaskill waved the high-hurdle card after being asked to defend Sotomayor’s infamous statement at a 2001 University of California at Berkeley speech asserting brown-skin moral authority: “I would hope that a wise Latina woman with the richness of her experiences would more often than not reach a better conclusion than a white male who hasn’t lived that life.” McCaskill actually denied that Sotomayor had make the remarks, then argued the words were taken out of context. You want context? It’s even worse than that soundbite. As National Journal legal analyst Stuart Taylor reported, “Sotomayor also referred to the cardinal duty of judges to be impartial as a mere ‘aspiration because it denies the fact that we are by our experiences making different choices than others.’ And she suggested that ‘inherent physiological or cultural differences’ may help explain why ‘our gender and national origins may and will make a difference in our judging.’” The full speech was reprinted in something called the Berkeley La Raza Law Journal. “La Raza” is Spanish for “The Race.” Imagine if a white male Republican court nominee had published in a law review called “The Race.” The selective elevation of hardship-as-primary qualification demeans the entire judiciary. If personal turmoil makes one “incredibly qualified to pass judgment on some of the most important cases in our country,” let’s put reality-show couple Jon and Kate Gosselin on the bench. Millions of viewers tune in to watch their “compelling personal story” of life with eight children on television. It’s a “richly, uniquely American experience” of facing obstacles and overcoming the odds. Get them robes and gavels, stat. McCaskill’s assertion that “overcoming incredible odds” is “new to the courts” is ridiculous. Is she arguing that Thurgood Marshall, Felix Frankfurter, and Sandra Day O’Connor faced lower hurdles than Sotomayor? And how about Clarence Thomas, a descendant of slaves, grew up in abject poverty in the South without a father. The object lesson, of course, is that not all compelling personal stories are equal. Thomas’s crime, of course, was embracing the wrong ideology. So his incredible set of odds and obstacles don’t count in left-wing eyes. Democrats are eager to celebrate diversity, you see, as long as the diversely-pigmented pledge allegiance to the Left for life. 'http://michellemalkin.com/2009/05/27/the-supreme-court-high-hurdles-contest/'
title: Who wrote that last year???????

content: quote: NO ONE can debate any Court action. The juries (We the people) at one time had the ability to declare "guilty, innocent, or bad law". it was an important function of a free society to have this power. Bring a copy of the US constitution to jury duty and you will surely be dismissed.
quote: NO ONE can debate any Court action.

content: In my opinion...balance is important in life...balance of debate on these boards...balance in government... To much power to suppress the views and opinions of others...leads to despots, dictators and monarchies... But, the pendulum DOES swing...before it swang right...now left...only when We learn to find the optimal middle ground for All...will We prosper... Sadly, it only seems to occur during War, when We share the sadness equally...share equal measures of remorse...and sorrow... We would do well to remember our common bonds more often...
